Transfect retroviral constructs \(based on the bicistronic vector, pMX-IRES-rCD2,

1) into the packaging cell line Phoenix using FuGene-6 reagent as instructed by supplier.
  2.
Collect retrovirus-containing supernatants 48 hours after transfection, and
Filtrate virus supernatants through 0.22μm pore PVDF membrane.
The filtrated supernatants can be stored for up to one week at 4°C.
Isolate bone marrow \(BM) cells from femurs and tibias of 8-12 week old mice.

Culture whole BM cells at 2 to 2.5 × 10<sup>6</sup> cells/ml in 10 ml of penicillin and streptomycin, 2mM L-glutamine, 50 μM β-mercaptoethanol, 10% fetal bovine serum-containing RPMI 1640 medium supplemented with recombinant mouse IL-3 \(5 ng/ml) for 9 days with medium changed every 3 days.
Enrich BM-derived basophils by depleting mast \(c-kit<sup>+</sup>) cells using IMag system or autoMACS as instructed by the supplier.
Treat 12-well plates with RetroNectin solution \(50 µg/ml in PBS) for 2 hours at room temperature, followed by 2% bovine serum albumin in PBS for 30 minutes.
8. Incubate the treated plates with the virus supernatants for 4 hours at 30°C. Add enriched BM-derived basophils \(0.5 to 1 × 10<sup>6</sup> cells/ml) and culture for 2 days for infection.

For stimulating with IL-3, infected BM-derived basophils are ‘starved’ by culturing in culture media without IL-3 for 12 to 18 hours before enrich rat CD2<sup>+</sup> cells with IMag system and/or AutoMACS.
